column4: in upgrading from 7.10 to 8.04, the upgrader stalls at "About 4 minutes remaining" and the last console text is "Generating locales... en_AU.UTF-8..."
it seems the console will not roll out new text anymore (it has been staying there for hours)
how do i rescue this upgrade?
help!
At this point.. it would be best if you don't. Install from scratch if you can - you did have a backup of /home, right?
(If you don't, it's not to late to make one now)
it seems some packages still need setting up. can i close the upgrader and manually run something to continue/redo package setting up?
Yes. But I can't tell you over irc what, and since you're asking, you won't manage either. :/
You can certainly /try/, but it's likely to break things even worse
(Of course, at this point, that won'T really hurt you. Have fun.)
man, how could this be... i was upgrading from a fresh 7.10 to 8.04...
i think the ugrader is waiting for something to close
Computer software sucks. And I'm saying this as a CS student.
i'm talking to you as a cs dropout :)
Perhaps, but forcibly killing whatever it is is unlikely to do you any favors
there is a Power Manager tray icon running which can't normally be closed which i highly suspect caused the endless delay
i started system monitor and killed a single process responsible for setting up new locales and the upgrader now continues.

and the upgrader reported a message (which does not prevent it from continuing):  The upgrade will continue but the 'locales' package may be in a not working state. Please consider submitting a bugreport about it.
now the question is how do i manually install/setup the "locales" package?
dpkg-reconfigure lcoales
nice!
/usr/sbin/dpkg-reconfigure: locales is broken or not fully installed
apt-get -f install, then
